item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

BAsh:

@Ollie: if you tried to click on the character in the last picture anywhere in the green volume it wouldn’t actually be a click on the character unless you also clicked on the pixels of the player.

This is what i thought also, however when you move the mouse even over the top corner it still can select the player

Read full topic

item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:5, topic:277071”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=365737.msg2774090#msg2774090 date=1241412016]

…except they arent the bounds of the objects

I think they are the bounds of the sprite but the “click mask” for the object is derived from the alpha of the sprite as well so the bounds are not sufficient.
[/quote]what the fuck are you on about[/quote]
The sprite may be 100 pixels by 100pixels. Clicking anywhere within this area (when transposed onto the 3d plane) doesn’t mean you click on the sprite. In reality you can only click where the sprite actually draws a pixel. It appears this area is what ollie’s bot is drawing rather than clickable area.

@Ollie: if you tried to click on the character in the last picture anywhere in the green volume it wouldn’t actually be a click on the character unless you also clicked on the pixels of the player.

Read full topic

the model class stores the AABB, there is no reason you cant draw it, rather than whatever you are currently doing

item.title: Arcanum
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

frank_:

it looks like it has nothing to do with the objects, it looks as though it is based on the tiles

I am displaying all the objects, Interactive, Boundary, Item and the other ones I have yet to name.

the interactive objects (i.e. trees) all have sizes, normally their default tile (such as in RSBot etc.) would return the bottom left corner of the object, now this would be OK if it were a one tiled object, however there are lots of larger objects which this does not work for, which is where using the size comes in to working out its centre tile and boundary. NB: size is not a variable that I hooked from the client.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 04-05-2009, 00:39:00[/size][hr]
This is with interactive and item objects only enabled

Read full topic
